title: Bayesian linear regression models — gbayes
text: Bayesian linear regression (BLR) models: - unified mapping genetic variants, estimation genetic parameters  (e.g. heritability) prediction disease risk) - handles different genetic architectures (large, many small effects) - scale large data (e.g. sparse LD) Bayesian multiple regression model posterior density  model parameters depend likelihood data given  parameters prior probability model parameters prior density marker effects defines whether model  induce variable selection shrinkage shrinkage .  Also, choice prior define extent type shrinkage induced. Ideally choice prior marker effect reflect genetic  architecture trait, vary (perhaps lot) across traits. following prior distributions provided: Bayes N: Assigning Gaussian prior marker effects implies posterior means  BLUP estimates (Ridge Regression). Bayes L: Assigning double-exponential Laplace prior density used  Bayesian LASSO Bayes : similar ridge regression t-distribution prior (rather Gaussian)  marker effects ; variance comes inverse-chi-square distribution instead fixed. Estimation  via Gibbs sampling. Bayes C: uses “rounded spike” (low-variance Gaussian) origin many small  effects can contribute polygenic component, reduces dimensionality  model (makes Gibbs sampling feasible). Bayes R: Hierarchical Bayesian mixture model 4 Gaussian components,  variances scaled 0, 0.0001 , 0.001 , 0.01 .
